messages.subject: History Channel Samurai Special
messages.msgSnippet: I do not know if this has been discussed on this list before (I am new!) But the History Channel is airing a special on the Samurai. The Samurai Monday,
messages.messageBody:
I do not know if this has been discussed on this list before (I am new!)
But the History Channel is airing a special on the Samurai.



The Samurai





Monday, December 8 @ 9pm ET/PT



The knights of medieval Japan, the Samurai held power for over 700 years.
Ferocious in combat, these masters of sword and bow were bound by an
unforgiving code of ethics. Their legacy of martial artistry, ceremony,
self-discipline, and tenacity persists. Explore the history and mystery of
this elite warrior class as present-day Samurai demonstrate their ancient
skills in this 2-hour special, and historians and experts examine the
meaning and ritual of Bushido--the way of the warrior. TV PG







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Happy Days was The Last Samurai

I believe the author is Mikiso Hane. Haven't seen that book in
years.


> Mr. Lee makes some good points, read "Peasants, Outcasts and
Rebels", I

the

peasant

messages.msgSnippet: From: Lee Changsub  ... Mr. Lee makes some good points, read Peasants, Outcasts and Rebels , I forgot the name of the author, it will give
messages.messageBody:
From: Lee Changsub <knorr31@...>

>Subject: Re: Re: "The Last Samurai"
>
>A real social change did not mature to exist until
>General MacArthur passed the land reform bill after
>World War Two...
>
>
>
Mr. Lee makes some good points, read "Peasants, Outcasts and Rebels", I
forgot the name of the author, it will give you a good feeling for the
evolution of Japanese politics in this period. Also why being a peasant
sucks!

Jim Eckman
